item.title: Analysis of Green Card processing time
item.description: This short project investigates whether the Trump administration has slowed down the labor certification & green card application process for foreign workers. The analysis relies on DOL/OFLC and USCIS open data. Results Short Article Code on Github

item.title: NYE fundraising data analysis
item.description: Since March 2018, I have worked part-time as a Pro-Bono Fundraising Data Analyst for the nonprofit organization New York Encounter. I performed several ETL tasks –via SQL-based data transformations and R programming– to set up the integration of data that existed in separate and disconnected platforms. Namely, the Nonprofit had informations on donors and attendees on SendGrid, donations recorded via Square and miscellaneous other information in Salesforce. After cleaning and merging such information, I performed an initial explorative characterization of the Nonprofit private donors.

item.title: LinkdIn Data: competitivity of cities
item.description: This mini-study project was a take-home test I completed in winter 2018 as part of a job interview for a consultancy with IFC (in collaboration with LinkedIn). I used it as an opportunity to refresh some R programming and learn to use the xaringan package to make html presentations. Results Slides (xaringan) Code on Github

item.title: World Development Indicator: life expectancy analysis
item.description: This mini-study project was an exercise to learn how to use the World Bank’s API for the World Development Indicator (WDI) repository. In this study, I explore the indicator Life expectancy at birth and I also do some comparative analisys using other indicators that I expect to be highly correlated with life expectancy: namely GDP and the status of Fragile and conflict affected situations (FCS).
